tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE game_event_schedule (
    event_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    event_name STRING,
    event_date TIMESTAMP,
    event_description STRING,
    notification_sent BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE game_events (
    event_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    event_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    event_date TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    event_description TEXT,
    event_location VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE notifications (
    notification_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    event_id UUID,
    notification_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    notification_message TEXT,
    notification_date TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (event_id) REFERENCES game_events(event_id)
);

CREATE TABLE game_events (
    event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_name VARCHAR(255),
    event_type VARCHAR(50),
    event_date TIMESTAMP,
    event_description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE event_notifications (
    notification_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_id INT REFERENCES game_events(event_id),
    notification_type VARCHAR(50),
    notification_message TEXT,
    notification_status BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE community_engagement (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50),
    email VARCHAR(100),
    subscription_level INT,
    last_login TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE game_events (
  event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  event_name VARCHAR(255),
  event_date DATE,
  event_time TIME,
  max_players INT
)

CREATE TABLE player_data (
  player_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  player_name VARCHAR(255),
  player_email VARCHAR(255),
  player_level INT,
  last_played DATE
)

CREATE TABLE event_participation (
  participation_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  event_id INT,
  player_id INT,
  participation_status VARCHAR(50),
  FOREIGN KEY (event_id) REFERENCES game_events(event_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (player_id) REFERENCES players(player_id)
)

CREATE TABLE notifications (
  notification_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  notification_type VARCHAR(50),
  notification_message TEXT,
  notification_time DATETIME,
  recipient_id INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (recipient_id) REFERENCES player_data(player_id)
)

CREATE TABLE game_events (
  event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  event_name VARCHAR(50),
  event_date DATE,
  event_time TIME,
  location VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE event_participants (
  participant_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  event_id INT,
  participant_name VARCHAR(50),
  email_address VARCHAR(100),
  phone_number VARCHAR(15)
);

CREATE TABLE event_attendance (
  attendance_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  event_id INT,
  participant_id INT,
  attendance_status VARCHAR(20),
  attendance_datetime DATETIME
);

CREATE TABLE event_comments (
  comment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  event_id INT,
  participant_id INT,
  comment_text TEXT,
  comment_datetime DATETIME
);
